snippet: Anticorruption activists want the president to back public registration of shell-company owners, which they hope can deter tax evasion and money laundering.
abstract: Anticorruption activists urge Pres Obama to back plan to publicly register owners of shell companies in United States and around world, saying move is essential to thwart corrupt government officials, tax evaders and money launderers who rely on opaque financial system; plan is supported by British Prime Min David Cameron.
lead_paragraph: Anticorruption activists want the president to back public registration of shell-company owners, which they hope can deter tax evasion and money laundering.

headline.seo: Activists Ask Obama to Shed Light on Shell Companies
headline.main: Obama Urged to Back Plan to List Owners of Shell Firms
headline.print_headline: Obama Urged To Back Plan To List Owners Of Shell Firms
